metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3426 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in Python 3's pydoc. A local or adjacent attacker who discovers or is able to convince another local or adjacent user to start a pydoc server could access the server and use it to disclose sensitive information belonging to the other user that they would not normally be able to access. The highest risk of this flaw is to data confidentiality. This flaw affects Python versions before 3.8.9, Python versions before 3.9.3 and Python versions before 3.10.0a7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3426` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> getfile introduced in 3.2.0 sbeattie> upstream fixed this by removing the getfile feature

criterions.comment: python3.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm2').
